name: SunFarmer
headline: Reliable and affordable solar energy in developing countries.
description:
SunFarmer provides affordable solar energy for hospitals, schools, businesses, and farms in developing countries.

In many parts of the world, electricity is unavailable, unstable, or extremely expensive. Yet reliable electricity is critical for high quality healthcare, modern education, economic development, and improved agricultural productivity. 

Learn more at sunfarmer.org

founders.name: Jason Gray
founders.description:
Presently, Founder and Managing General Partner of Pioneer Fund. 
Previously, Co-Founder of SunFarmer, a solar energy company.   
Prior to that, Jason held various roles in finance, energy, and agriculture, including as General Manager and Vice President of  SunEdison.  In this role, he established the company’s Canadian division, building it to $250M in annual revenue and managed over $500M in debt in equity.

founders.name: Andy Moon
founders.description:
Co-Founder and CEO of Reunion, renewable energy finance platform /
Co-Founder and Board member at SunFarmer /
Raised over $200M in debt and equity to fund solar energy projects / 
Investor in a few awesome early stage companies including Chronosphere

# Bringing power to where it’s needed the most.
FEATURED BY
## Mission
Our mission is to provide solar energy services, creating meaningful impact in the lives of our customers through excellence in quality, innovation and service.
## The Challenge
1.2 billion people globally lack access to electricity. In Nepal, 26% of population currently have no source of electricity forcing them to use traditional forms of energy.
  * 34,398,833 Cubic Meters of Water Pumped
  * 12,479,140 Units of Clean Electricity Produced
  * 13,364,384 Kgs of CO2 Offest


# **Powering health, education, and agriculture with solar.**

generated_description:
SunFarmer is on a mission to bring reliable and affordable solar energy to developing countries—an ambition that sits at the intersection of sustainability and social impact. Founded in 2015, as part of the Y Combinator Batch S15, the company is based in Kathmandu, Nepal, and is tackling one of the pressing challenges of our time: access to electricity. 

In many regions, particularly in developing countries, electricity is often scarce, unreliable, or exorbitantly priced. This lack of energy access affects critical areas such as healthcare, education, economic development, and agriculture. In fact, 1.2 billion people worldwide are without electricity, and Nepal alone sees 26% of its population relying on traditional energy sources.

SunFarmer aims to change this by providing solar energy solutions specifically designed for hospitals, schools, businesses, and farms. The organization has achieved impressive outcomes, having pumped over 34 million cubic meters of water, produced more than 12 million units of clean electricity, and offset about 13.4 million kilograms of CO2. 

The SunFarmer team, comprised of 15 dedicated employees, is passionate about crafting solar energy systems that not only meet the immediate energy needs of communities but also foster long-term environmental benefits. They offer services that allow local entities to "Get Solar" and even "Give Solar," thus engaging a broader community in their mission.

For those keen on getting involved or learning more, visit [SunFarmer](http://sunfarmer.org). It’s clear: they’re not just lighting up buildings; they’re illuminating the path toward a sustainable future for communities that need it the most.
